name: Solving Equations & Expressions
description: Mastering techniques for solving algebraic equations and simplifying mathematical expressions.

cards.title: Solving Linear Equations
cards.description: Understanding how to solve equations with one variable and interpret their solutions.
bulletpoints: A linear equation is of the form \( ax + b = 0 \), where \( a \neq 0 \)
Solve for \( x \) by isolating the variable: \[ x = \frac{-b}{a} \]
Balance equations by applying the same operation to both sides

cards.title: Solving Quadratic Equations
cards.description: Techniques for solving second-degree polynomial equations.
bulletpoints: A quadratic equation has the form \( ax^2 + bx + c = 0 \)
Use the quadratic formula: \[ x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} \]
Factor quadratics when possible: \[ x^2 - 5x + 6 = (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0 \]

cards.title: Solving Higher-Degree Polynomial Equations
cards.description: Techniques for solving polynomials of degree 3 or higher.
bulletpoints: A polynomial equation has the general form \( P(x) = 0 \)
Use synthetic division to test rational roots
Factor polynomials when possible, then apply the zero product property

cards.title: Solving Exponential & Logarithmic Equations
cards.description: Understanding how to solve equations involving exponentials and logarithms.
bulletpoints: An exponential equation has the form \( a^x = b \); take the logarithm of both sides
Convert between exponential and logarithmic form: \[ x = \log_b(y) \Leftrightarrow b^x = y \]
Use logarithmic properties: \[ \log(a^b) = b \log a \]

cards.title: Solving Rational Equations
cards.description: Solving equations involving fractions with variables in the denominator.
bulletpoints: A rational equation is of the form \( \frac{P(x)}{Q(x)} = 0 \)
Clear denominators by multiplying by the least common denominator (LCD)
Check for extraneous solutions by verifying restrictions on \( x \)

cards.title: Solving Absolute Value Equations
cards.description: Understanding solutions for equations involving absolute values.
bulletpoints: An absolute value equation has the form \( |x - a| = b \)
Solve by splitting into two cases: \[ x - a = b \text{ or } x - a = -b \]
Graph absolute value functions to visualize their solutions

cards.title: Solving Systems of Equations
cards.description: Techniques for solving multiple equations with multiple variables.
bulletpoints: A system of equations consists of multiple equations with shared variables
Solve using substitution: \[ x + y = 5, \quad 2x - y = 3 \]
Use elimination to eliminate a variable by adding or subtracting equations

cards.title: Solving and Graphing Inequalities
cards.description: Understanding how to solve and visualize inequalities.
bulletpoints: A linear inequality has the form \( ax + b > c \)
Solve like an equation, but reverse the inequality when multiplying/dividing by a negative number
Graph solutions on a number line, using open/closed circles for strict/non-strict inequalities

cards.title: Solving Trigonometric Equations
cards.description: Finding solutions for equations involving trigonometric functions.
bulletpoints: Solve equations like \( \sin x = \frac{1}{2} \) using inverse trigonometric functions
Use trigonometric identities to simplify equations
Consider periodic solutions: \[ \theta = \frac{\pi}{6} + 2\pi k \text{ for integer } k \]

cards.title: Solving Equations with Complex Numbers
bulletpoints: The imaginary unit is defined as \( i^2 = -1 \)
Solve quadratic equations with negative discriminants: \[ x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} \]
Express complex solutions in the form \( a + bi \)

cards.title: Solving Matrix Equations
cards.description: Techniques for solving equations using matrices.
bulletpoints: A system of equations can be written as \( AX = B \) where \( A \) is a coefficient matrix
Find solutions using the inverse matrix: \[ X = A^{-1} B \]
Use row reduction (Gaussian elimination) to simplify systems

cards.title: Solving Summation and Series Equations
cards.description: Understanding summation notation and solving series-related problems.
bulletpoints: Use sigma notation to express sums: \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n} k = \frac{n(n+1)}{2} \]
Solve arithmetic series equations: \[ S_n = \frac{n}{2} (a + l) \]
Evaluate geometric series using: \[ S_n = \frac{a(1 - r^n)}{1 - r} \]
